Recap: Lizzie has labor pains again. Reva gets her ready for Cedars. Billy and Rick have a talk about Thanksgiving and family and why they both are at a hangout. Marina and Coop are at the police station where Marina is still working on a case. Coop has brought her something to eat. Josh is talking to Marah about Reva and why she didn't spend Thanksgiving with them. Cassie and Tammy also talk about Thanksgiving and that Cassie will make it a good one if it kills her. Marah is angry that Reva and Josh are not together and that Cassie and Tammy tries to explain it to her. Reva rushes Lizzie out to go to the hospital. Remy joins Cassie and Tammy, Josh for Thanksgiving. Josh reads Marah the riot act about her attitude toward Cassie. Marah tells Josh what she thinks. Reva and Alan argue about Jonathan and Lizzie. Jonathan and Lizzie get stuck in his truck in the snow. Jonathan goes to try to push the truck out leaving Lizzie his cellphone and telling her to call 911 if not back in 10 minutes. Billy arrives at Josh and Cassie's. Marina and Coop talk about her getting a boyfriend and that Marina isn't surprised that Frank or Buzz haven't gone to the old country to get her a boyfriend. Tammy and Remy travel for a meal. Reva and Alan finally leave for the hosp. Remy and Tammy come to Jonathan and Lizzie's rescue. Alan and Reva get to the hosp before Jonathan and Lizzie making Alan very angry. RJ is not happy that Tammy isnt there for Thanksgiving Marah even wants to go. Marah and Cassie have a little talk. Billy arrives at Josh and Cassie's and takes Marah with him to Reva's not knowing that Reva is busy with Jonathan and Lizzie.
Transcript: Reva: Okay, that about wraps it up. Let's leave.
Lizzie: It's my water.
Reva: No more toasts, no more toast.
Lizzie: No, no, water.
Alan: Sweetheart, I'll get you some.
Lizzie: No, no, it's my water. My water broke!
Reva: Your water broke? She's going into labor.
Jonathan: Here we go.
Lizzie: No, no, no. This isn't happening. This can't be happening. It's weeks early. It's too early.
Reva: It's okay.
Alan: I'll have Bruno bring the car around.
Reva: It's okay. Women have babies early all of the time.
Lizzie: Yeah, but I'm not ready for this. I was going to get my hair done and a pedicure.
Reva: Lizzie!
Lizzie: I haven't even shaved my legs!
Reva: Your doctor's not going to mind. Look, first-time babies take a while to come. We have time.
Lizzie: How long?
Reva: Dylan was 36 hours.
Lizzie: Oh, my God.
Reva: It's okay. We'll get your bag.
Lizzie: My bag. My bag's not here. It's not here! I left it at home. This isn't supposed to be happening today.
Reva: Calm down. I'll get your coat.
Lizzie: This isn't supposed to be happening today. Where's Jonathan! Ow!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: How's the bird?
Cassie: Hey. I think it's looking good, don't you?
Josh: Nice.
Cassie: Hey, Happy Thanksgiving.
Josh: Yeah, it will be. The first of many for us, I think.
Cassie: Would you grab me the baster? I think I left it over by the sink.
Josh: Yeah, no problem. (Laughter)
Cassie: I'm sorry the veterans couldn't make it.
Josh: Well-- oh, here it is. There's always next year. There you go.
Cassie: (Laughing) Right next to me. Yeah, I just... I don't know. It's going to be fine. You know, it's going to be fine, even without--
Josh: Everybody?
Cassie: Yeah. It is getting kind of late. Do you think they're going to make it?
Josh: You mean Billy, Reva or Jonathan?
Cassie: All of the above.
Josh: You don't?
Cassie: I don't know. All I know is that when I woke up this morning, a little part of me wished they wouldn't because I'm pretty drama'ed out.
Josh: Well, I certainly understand that feeling. But, we all have to be together tonight, all of us.
Cassie: I know. And I do miss my sister.
Josh: I'm sure Reva and Jonathan will be here.
Cassie: You think?
Josh: Yes. Hey, it's Thanksgiving, right? And we're a family. Come here. Come here.
[SCENE_BREAK]
R.J.: I need your help.
Tammy: What's up, R.J.?
R.J.: Mom said I could say grace this year, but I don't know how.
Tammy: Well, just think about whatever your thankful for and say whatever comes out.
R.J.: That's it?
Tammy: Yeah, nothing to it.
Marah: Especially this year.
Tammy: You know you have a lot to be thankful for, your mom.
Marah: I know.
Tammy: Maybe they're just running late.
Josh: Hey, guys, we're going to hold off on dinner until Reva and Jonathan get here, okay?
R.J.: I'm starving.
Josh: It won't be that long, pal. I promise.
Marah: Have they called?
Josh: No, I'm just guessing they're having a hard time getting here because of the snow.
Marah: Or maybe Mom doesn't want to come and spend Thanksgiving with her husband and another woman.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Where is Jonathan? I need him, Reva.
Reva: We'll find him. Let's just get you ready. Here.
Alan: Bruno's having to dig the car out of the snow, but it should have been in the garage. It'll only take him a minute.
Lizzie: Well, we... we have to get to the hospital.
Reva: We have time. We have time.
Lizzie: Granddad, did you see Jonathan out there?
Alan: What, he's gone?
Reva: He stepped out!
Alan: Why am I not surprised!
Reva: Alan, don't! Stop it!
Alan: We're not going to wait for him, Reva.
Reva: He didn't just leave. (Car tires screeching)
Jonathan: You ready, Lizzie? Let's go have this baby.
Lizzie: Oh, no! Don't pick me up! No!
Jonathan: Come on, come on.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rick: Hey, Billy.
Billy: Hey, what's up, Doc?
Rick: Oh, yeah, like I've never heard that one before. Whatever you have on tap sounds good to me. What's the score?
Billy: Dallas is up by three.
Rick: Oh.
Billy: Have you been to a meeting lately?
Rick: Club soda and some pretzels. If you've got it.
Bill: Okay.
Rick: Boy, this place is like a ghost town.
Billy: Yeah. Well, it's Thanksgiving. Don't eat too much because your wife will have your head.

Rick: Yeah, my wife. Yeah, my wife took my little girl to her parents' house and I wasn't invited. It's okay. I spent a couple hours at the clinic, and I'm sure I'll get paged by the hospital on a night like this. There's a good call.
Billy: Just doing my job.
Rick: Oh, that, no. I was talking about the football game, Billy. The ref made a good call. I drove by the house.
Billy: Mel's parents?
Rick: Yeah. I mean I don't even know why I bothered because I didn't even stop. So, what about you, what's your excuse?
Billy: I wasn't invited to Mel's parents either.
Rick: (Laughs)
[SCENE_BREAK]
Coop: Ooh, I'll take an action figure if you're in the generous mood.
Marina: (Laughs) Too late. I already got you your gift.
Coop: Too late...? Marina, it's Thanksgiving, you've already got all of your Christmas shopping done?
Marina: Yes, I know. It's been a slow night. And thank you so much. Uncle Henry, you shouldn't have.
Coop: I know I shouldn't have, but I kind of had too. Frank and dad are passed out asleep-- probably dead because of the football game.
Marina: (Laughs) They're dead because our team won.
Coop: That's true. That's true.
Marina: I was counting on you to bring over something tonight to eat. That's why I laid off the doughnuts the guys left in the room.
Coop: Oh.
Marina: So, can you stick around or do you have to get back to Ava?
Coop: Well, you know, Ava's back doing dishes where she should be, you know. Just kidding. No, she said that I can go ahead and take as much time as I want. So I can, uh... stay with you.
Marina: Oh, I love that girl. You know, it's turned out to be a pretty good Thanksgiving.
Coop: It has. It has, which is kind of weird. It's kind of like a turnaround for the Cooper's, you know? Things are getting better. People are starting to actually be happy.
Marina: Shh!
Coop: What?
Marina: Don't say that too loud, unless you want a brick to fall on your head or a Spaulding to show up and mess it all up.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: This farmhouse is a great place for Thanksgiving, don't you think? Especially in the snow.
Marah: Not as nice though as Cross Creek.
Josh: Okay. Yeah, did you see the decorations that R.J. did out by the barn?
Marah: I should call Mom.
Josh: Okay, Marah, please don't ruin it for her.
Marah: So this is all about Cassie, huh?
Josh: Don't ruin it for all of us, or for yourself. This is a very important night. It's a chance for us to prove we're still a family.
R.J.: Hey, Marah, did you miss Thanksgiving when you were in Paris?
Marah: I still miss it.
Tammy: Remember, it's your house.
Cassie: Things will pick up once everyone gets here.
Tammy: Oh, yeah, I'm sure.
Cassie: We're going to have a good Thanksgiving if it kills me.
Tammy: Yeah, well it just might. You and Josh.
Cassie: Hey, go throw these at your cousin for me.
Tammy: Here.
Marah: Thanks. You want?
Tammy: No, I'm good. Thanks.
Marah: Dad?
Josh: No, thank you. In fact, we're going to eat pretty quick.
R.J.: I'll give thanks for that. (Laughter)
Cassie: Wine?

Josh: So, Marah, do you remember-- thank you. Do you remember that Thanksgiving-- you were pretty young, actually-- it snowed for several days in a row and we couldn't get to the store, and I think we ended up eating leftover chicken.
Marah: And frozen french fries.
Josh: That's right.
Marah: Instead of mashed potatoes. I remember Uncle Billy said that that was what the pilgrims and Indians really wanted to eat on the first Thanksgiving together.
Cassie: Yeah, that sounds like Billy.
Marah: And then we watched all of the holiday movies on TV.
Tammy: The same ones every year.
Marah: Oh, yeah, with popcorn. And Grandpa Hawk used to cry at the end of all of the sentimental ones.
Josh: That's right, he did.
Marah: Mom always loved that part. She always ended up in your arms on the couch.
Josh: Marah.
Marah: Why didn't we do Thanksgiving at Cross Creek this year? You brought it all the way up here.
Josh: Because it's not mine anymore.
Marah: It's still Mom's. There are so many memories in that place. She almost died. Why did you have to change everything on her?
Tammy: Her or you?
Marah: Come on, Tammy, you know this is messed up.
Cassie: Tammy, why don't you come help me in the kitchen?

Tammy: No. Seriously, Marah, just give it up. Did you really think that this would be some happy, normal Thanksgiving? Look, I know that you wish your parents were still together, but they aren't. Your dad is with my mom now, and they're happy. So be happy for them or give it up.
Cassie: Honey, it's okay.
Tammy: No, it's not okay. You invite her into your home, and then all she does is make you feel uncomfortable.
Cassie: Well, you know, this is a lot for her to deal with.
Marah: Hmmm? Yeah, you think? I haven't even been gone that long, and my dad is with my aunt and my cousin's with my brother. (All talking)
Tammy: Okay, I can't even believe...
Josh: Marah, let's... step outside for a minute.
Marah: No, no, no, Dad. You know you guys are wrong together.
Josh: I just want to step outside.
Marah: No, you all know it's wrong.
Tammy: You don't know anything.
R.J.: Can't we just eat?
All: No!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Easy, easy, just keep breathing.
Alan: You drove up my lawn?
Reva: Alan, please.
Alan: No, no, Elizabeth's not going with you. She's going with my driver.
Reva: No, your driver isn't even here, Alan.
Jonathan: Are you okay?
Lizzie: Yeah, it hurts.
Reva: That's good.
Jonathan: Don't worry we're going.
Reva: Just keep breathing.
Alan: Elizabeth, get out of that car.
Jonathan: It's my wife, it's my daughter, just leave it alone.
Reva: Go, go, I love you. I love you. Drive carefully, okay. We'll meet you at the hospital.
Jonathan: Okay. Thank you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Billy: Hey.
Rick: Hey. Thanks.
Billy: Leftovers are the best part of Thanksgiving.
Rick: Spoken like a couple of guys without dinner reservations.
Billy: Oh, I had an invite. I just... have a bar to run.
Rick: An empty, very empty bar, Billy.
Billy: You're here.
Rick: Yeah, I'm here... I'm here because I got a new ticker when the old one stopped. That's why I'm here.
Billy: It sounds to me like something to be thankful for.
Rick: Well, you'd know Billy. I mean, you spent the last couple of months preparing for a death that didn't happen.
Billy: Reva was the one who was dying.
Rick: Billy, it doesn't matter. You were there for her. You had to get ready for it. Right?
Billy: Eat your sandwich.
Rick: My time was running out. I said all of my big good-byes, I was ready to go.
Billy: Then you came back, right?
Rick: How do you top the big good-bye, Billy, when you come back? I'll tell you something, I've completely wasted my second chance.
Billy: Well, I prayed like heck for a miracle to save Reva, and then she got saved.

Rick: But you feel like you've lost her, right, Billy? You know, I don't know what Reva's going to do with her second lease on life, but Billy, if I were you and I had some family that wanted me to join them at their Thanksgiving table, I'd be there. (Beeper beeping) See, it's the hospital.
Billy: You'd go, even if it hurt like hell?
Rick: Yep. It beats going cold turkey, Billy.
[SCENE_BREAK]
R.J.: Why is everyone mad?
Cassie: No one is mad, honey. We're just hungry.
Tammy: I'm mad.
Cassie: Tammy.
Tammy: What, this isn't working.
Cassie: Everyone has got it out of their systems now.
Tammy: Well, everyone is not here.
Cassie: Josh says they'll be here. They'll be here.
Tammy: I wanted this to work for you, Mom. It's just too soon, okay? Maybe next year. (Knock on door)
R.J.: They're here!
Remy: Hey, R.J., Happy Thanksgiving. I'm a little early.
Tammy: It's okay.
Cassie: Remy, hi. Happy Thanksgiving.
Remy: Hi, Happy Thanksgiving.
Cassie: Thank you. I'm glad you're here. You know, we haven't started yet, still waiting on some people. It's perfect.
Remy: Thanks, Cassie, but I'm on duty.
Tammy: Yeah, Remy told me I could do a ride-along.
Cassie: You're leaving?
Tammy: I felt bad that he had to work the holiday alone.
Cassie: Excuse me, we're just going to check on the turkey.
Tammy: But we just... okay.
R.J.: They're having a bad day.
Remy: Yeah, I'm getting that.
Cassie: You can't leave; it's Thanksgiving.
Tammy: You're letting all of the heat out.
Cassie: And I don't want you on the roads tonight. It's dangerous.
Tammy: Looks like it's almost done.
Cassie: And Reva's going to want to see you when she gets here.
Tammy: Mom... I don't think I can do this.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: You're not helping.
Marah: Dad...
Josh: Marah, you're not helping. You hurt Tammy's feelings and you hurt Cassie's feelings.
Marah: I'm sorry.
Josh: Marah, do you honestly think that if you make this difficult for everybody that somehow that's going to send me running back into your mom's arms?
Marah: No.
Josh: I was really looking forward to tonight, having Thanksgiving with my daughter.
Marah: Why do I feel like I'm the only grownup here?
Josh: Excuse me?
Marah: You're all way too busy trying to pull off this happy little family that you're forgetting everything that is happening. Mom still has a long road ahead of her. She isn't better yet.
Josh: Look, I realize that you're trying to protect your mom. I get that, okay?
Marah: No, no, I'm trying to protect you, Dad. Because if something happens to her, if she gets sick again and you're not there, I don't think you could forgive yourself.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: We had a bag packed at the house, but I'd rather just go straight to the hospital.
Alan: Can I help in any way?
Reva: Yeah, you throwing yourself under my son's car out there would have been a big help.
Alan: Reva, can we try to get along for the child's sake? It's Thanksgiving. I'm offering you an olive branch.
Reva: No, actually you're not. You hate Jonathan; you're using Lizzie to get to their baby. The only branch you're offering is poison ivy.
Alan: The only thing I want is to be a part of that little girl's life.
Reva: Yeah. I'm so glad I'm going to get a chance to see little Reva myself.
Alan: Little what?
Reva: Yeah. Jonathan whispered it in my ear as they were pulling away.
Alan: I won't allow it!
Reva: Ah, there's that Alan I know and love. Will you try your driver again, please?
Alan: So they're not really going to name it little Reva?
Reva: No, but if I would have had kicked, they might have done in my honor.
Alan: Over my dead body.
Reva: No, mine.
Alan: This is going to be a long rest of my life.
Reva: I have a lot of faith in those kids.
Alan: In my Elizabeth?
Reva: Yes, I'm really warming up to her. She's trying very hard and she loves that baby.
Alan: Well, I'm glad that you see that.
Reva: Now, if you'd just give Jonathan a chance...
Alan: I'd regret it.
Reva: Damn it, Alan, he's going to be a better father than you ever were.
Alan: There's that Reva I know.
Reva: (Laughs)
[SCENE_BREAK]
(Car revving)
Lizzie: What? What happened?
Jonathan: We're stuck in the snow, but I'll get us out.
Lizzie: Stuck? Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God.
Jonathan: Lizzie, don't freak out on me.
Lizzie: It's supposed to be a shortcut.
Jonathan: It is, it's just not plowed right.
Lizzie: (Screaming) Get us out of here!
Jonathan: Okay, are you doing your breathing thing?
Lizzie: Oh, you mean that thing you missed when you ditched me at the birthing class?
Jonathan: Lizzie, I'm trying.
Lizzie: (Screaming) Get us out of here.
Jonathan: All right, I'm not going to let anything happen to you or the baby, okay? So just do your breathing, okay, or whatever. Call 911 just in case.
Lizzie: I don't have my bag.
Jonathan: Here. Here, here, here, here, here. Here, okay? I'll be right back.
Lizzie: Do you mean it?
Jonathan: Yeah, I'm just going to get out and push the car.
Lizzie: No, the thing that you said earlier about not letting anything bad happen to us. Because if I was you and this baby wasn't inside me, I would be scared enough to take off.
Jonathan: You want me to get us out of here or no? (Car honking)
Jonathan: Lizzie, Lizzie, are you okay?
Lizzie: Yeah, I think so, yeah.
Jonathan: The baby?
Lizzie: Yeah, we're both okay.
Jonathan: Can you... can you move?
Lizzie: What was that?
Jonathan: A car swerving off, I think.
Lizzie: Your leg.
Jonathan: It's fine, it's nothing.
Lizzie: No, you're bleeding. (Groans)
Jonathan: What? What is it?
Lizzie: I don't know, I'm just in labor.
Jonathan: Right, right. All right, don't worry, we'll make it out of here in time, okay?
Lizzie: This isn't supposed to happen today.
Jonathan: Okay, don't cry.
Lizzie: It's not supposed to happen like this. This isn't the way it's supposed to go.
Jonathan: Where's my phone?
Lizzie: I don't know. Where are you going? Where are you going?

Jonathan: Hi. Yeah, car accident on Pine Road going towards Cedars. My wife is going into labor, so we need someone here immediately, okay. Thanks. Hey, ambulance is on the way, okay? That other car went over the railing, and it's in the ditch.
Lizzie: What about the other people?
Jonathan: I can't tell. But can you crawl... can you crawl over to the driver's side?
Lizzie: (Crying)
Jonathan: Okay. All right, don't worry about it. Just stay here. I'm going to go push. You don't push. Don't push.

Lizzie: Oh, it's okay, baby. It's okay. Reva said that we have lots of time. So pretty soon we're going to be in a nice, warm hospital, okay? Is it working out there? He's going to get us out so don't be scared, okay? (Screaming) Oh, come on work with me here, baby. Ow! You know, the last time that I was scared like this... (groans) ...I was just a little girl and I was really, really sick, but I got better. And you know why? (Groans) Oh, God. Because I had my daddy with me. He was brave when I couldn't be, and... (groans) ...that's exactly what your daddy is doing for you right now. So he's not scared of anything. (Groans)
Jonathan: (Breathing heavy)
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: I could use your help, you know?
Tammy: You just want me to stay.
Cassie: You know, today isn't just about me. It's important to Josh, too.
Tammy: Well, it's not going to be what you guys want it to be.
Cassie: Why? Because Jonathan isn't here?
Tammy: Okay, that's not fair.
Cassie: Honey, you leaving is not right. Don't do it.

Tammy: I love you, Mom, and I'm all for you and Josh being together, but you can't force everybody else to like it. Okay, turkey and stuffing is not going to fix this family. You tried, but it's over. Okay, I'm going.
Cassie: Tammy.
Tammy: Remy. I'm sorry. Happy Thanksgiving. Oh, hey, Billy.
Billy: Hey.
Tammy: Good luck.
Cassie: Oh, no, no, no, you don't.
Marah: He made it.
Josh: Marah, we're not done here.
Marah: What else is there to say, Dad? You won't talk about Mom.

Josh: Look, nothing that's happening right now can take away what we had as a family. All right? I love your mom. I want what's best for her. But that family we used to have is never coming back. This... this is a family, too. It's different, it's new for everyone, but it can work.
Marah: Maybe for you and Cassie.
Josh: And maybe for your mom, and maybe even for you. It's still a Lewis Thanksgiving, Marah.
Billy: Hey, if you say so, Josh. How you doing, sweetie? Reva's not coming, is she?
Josh: We haven't heard from her.

Billy: You're always the optimist. You think you can fix just about anything. But I'll tell you something, you can't force a good ol' turkey day. You may be able to name a hospital after H.B., but that doesn't make you him.
Cassie: Billy, what are you doing?
Marah: Defending me. Thanks, Uncle Billy.
Billy: No problem.
Josh: No, actually, you know what? There is a problem.
Billy: Oh, really?
Cassie: Okay, here we go.
R.J.: Mom, the turkey.
Marah: This is not my fault.
Josh: Marah, just stop, all right.
R.J.: The turkey!
Marah: No, I just want to leave now.
Josh: No, no, everyone stays.
R.J.: The turkey!
Cassie: What do you mean? Excuse me. Oh, man.
Josh: I got it, I got it, I got it.
Cassie: Here.
Josh: Ow, ow!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: Mmm, I sure could go for seconds?
Coop: Well, sorry, I don't have seconds. By the way, I don't think I've seen anyone eat so fast before.
Marina: Well, I'm a waitress and a cop. Both jobs require that we have very, very fast and good food to mouth skills. You creative folk can be leisurely about your foods.
Coop: Okay.
Marina: But if I did that, I'd starve.
Coop: Well, fast eater, you add that to your profile thing.
Marina: What?
Coop: Your profile. Your little, online dating profile. You have one of those I thought, don't you?
Marina: Why can't someone in my family just come to terms with the fact I am happily single?
Coop: Marina, look, okay, we just want you to be happy. That's all we want.
Marina: Happy?
Coop: Uh-huh.
Marina: Let me think about all of the happy couples in this town... I'm done. You and Ava are happy, and that is nice.
Coop: Okay, all right. Well, honestly, look, I think your dad's a little concerned for you, that's all.
Marina: Well, he just needs to stop being so concerned. Actually, you know what? I'm surprised that he's not sent away for one of those nice guys from the old country.
Coop: I can always--
Marina: Don't give him any ideas.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: Wow, that's what you're eating for Thanksgiving dinner?
Remy: Actually, I've been really well-fed. Everyone in town's been handing out food because they feel bad I'm working Thanksgiving.
Tammy: I didn't bring anything.
Remy: That's not a problem.
Tammy: Thank you for getting me out of my mom's place. I don't think I could have taken much more.
Remy: Yeah, it seemed a little tense.
Tammy: You think? I've been to some bad holiday dinners, but that had to be the worse.
Remy: I'm sorry. If anyone deserves a nice and peaceful holiday, it's you. But I am glad to have your company.
Tammy: I'm not at my best.
Remy: Not a problem. Just... just chill.
Tammy: I owe you. You know what I think I'll do? I will cook us a real Thanksgiving dinner.
Remy: (Laughs)
Tammy: What?
Remy: Seriously?
Tammy: I am a good cook, okay? You can invite all of your cop friends, Marina will be there. It'll be great.
Remy: If you cook, I'll buy the groceries.
Tammy: All right, cool deal. Good, something to look forward to. I'm dying to do something normal.
Remy: Well, I'll do my best to make sure the rest of the night is nice and peaceful.
[SCENE_BREAK]
(Car honking)
Reva: Finally.
Alan: Reva, let's go!
Reva: I'm coming.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Take one down pass it around 74 bottles of beer on the wall 74 bottles of beer on the wall...
Jonathan: It's not working.
Lizzie: Why?
Jonathan: We have to go to plan "B."
Lizzie: What's that? (Sirens)
Jonathan: You just stay here.
Lizzie: Yeah, like I have a choice!
Jonathan: Hey, over here! Over here! Thank God.
Remy: You okay? What happened? I got a call from dispatch.
Jonathan: Lizzie's inside. We've got to get her out of there.
Tammy: You're hurt.
Lizzie: (Screaming)
Tammy: Oh, my God, she's having the baby.
Jonathan: No, not yet she isn't.
Remy: It's okay, Lizzie. The ambulance is on its way, all right? Just hang in there.
Lizzie: Jonathan.
Jonathan: I'm here, I'm here, I'm here.
Remy: How close are the contractions?
Jonathan: A... a few minutes in between still.
Remy: And the other guy just took off?
Jonathan: No, look, he's in that ditch down there. He fell.
Remy: Okay, you'll be okay if I...?
Jonathan: The ambulance is on its way?
Remy: Any minute.
Jonathan: Go, go, go.
Remy: I'll be back as soon as I can.
Jonathan: Hey. Hey, hey, hey, look at me. Look at me. You're going to be fine, okay?
Lizzie: It's happening.
Jonathan: No, no, not yet it's not. Help is on its way.
Lizzie: I can't do it like this.
Jonathan: You can. Hey, Lizzie, you're doing great, okay? You're doing great. You hear that, little one? Mommy's doing great, okay, so don't freak her out. You can mess with us when you get here.
Lizzie: She's rebelling already.
Jonathan: Yeah, well, she's our kid.
Tammy: Hey, Lizzie.
Lizzie: (Screaming) (Groans) I'm hot and I'm cold.
Jonathan: You're doing real good, Lizzie.
Lizzie: No, that one came faster. Reva said that we had time.
Jonathan: Well, Reva knows everything, so then we're good, okay?
Tammy: Keep breathing.
Lizzie: (Loud groans) Help me, help me!
Tammy: Okay, I'll do it with you. Are you ready?
Lizzie: Yeah.
Tammy: Okay? Breathe. Good.
Lizzie: (Lamaze breathing) (loud groan) Go get help!
Tammy: No, I don't need to.
Lizzie: I need you to for me. Go now.
Tammy: Okay, okay.
Lizzie: Get help please! Baby, wait, please!
Tammy: She needs you.
Jonathan: Well, I'm not going anywhere.
Tammy: I know that.
Jonathan: Where is the frickin' ambulance?
Tammy: We're all scared Jonathan.
Jonathan: No, I'm not scared. I'm pissed off because she is stuck in a smashed up car in the freezing cold. She should be at the hospital where somebody can help her.
Tammy: You are helping her, Jonathan.
Jonathan: Yeah.
Tammy: You are. When you're in something you're in it all the way and you're going to do everything you can to help Lizzie and the baby. Okay, I know you are.
Jonathan: Yeah, well, I'm not so sure, you know?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Rick, hi.
Rick: Hey, Reva, what are you doing here?
Reva: Where did they take Lizzie? Do you know where she is?
Rick: She's here?
Alan: Yes, she went into labor, Rick. I mean, they left before we did, she and Jonathan.
EMS worker: We've got a two car collision. Pine road and Route 33. Cops just called. One of the passengers is in labor.
Alan: Oh, my God. I knew I should have never let her go with him.
Reva: Just stop it, Alan. Stop it.
Rick: Let me see what I can find out.
Reva: Thanks, Rick.
Alan: Send a helicopter. My granddaughter is in labor.
Nurse: We're working on finding out specifics, Mr. Spaulding.
Alan: What are you waiting for? Pick up the phone.
Reva: Alan, Alan! Jonathan, pick up. Pick up the phone, Jonathan.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Marina: Thank you so much for bringing the food over. And tell my dad and my grandfather that I will be over tomorrow for all of the Thanksgiving leftover festivities, and please tell Ava thank you so much for sharing her honey bunny with me for a little while.
Coop: Uh-huh. Well, you are very welcome, and good luck with the rest of the shopping and what you got going on.
Marina: Yeah, well, you know, if tonight continues to be this slow, I just might finish my Christmas cards, too. Hey, tell my dad I don't want an arranged marriage, please?
Coop: Done.
Marina: Thank you. (Telephone ringing)
Coop: Have a good night.
Marina: Good night. (Telephone ringing) Detective Cooper. Hey, roomie. How's it out there on the streets? Please tell me as dead as... what? Lizzie? Oh, so much for a quiet Thanksgiving.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: How bad is it?
R.J.: Can we please order pizza?
Cassie: Honey, we still have mashed potatoes and cranberry sauce and pumpkin pie, and you are still going to say grace.
R.J.: Grace?
Cassie: Mm-hmm.
R.J.: I'm going to go play my video games.
Marah: I'm going to go.
Josh: Marah, come on. We'll figure something else out, okay?
Marah: I want to find Mom and wish her a Happy Thanksgiving. I'm not saying that to hurt you.
Cassie: No, I know. I know, Marah.
Marah: It's... when your parents split up, you always have it in your head that your mom and dad still belong together. Even if they do divorce every couple of years.
Josh: Marah, please.
Marah: I'm just saying that I don't hate her. I'm sorry that your Thanksgiving tanked, Aunt Cassie, and I know I contributed to it.
Cassie: I can't be mad at you, Marah. I know you got off a plane and walked into a new family. Or the same family, but different. I'm just... I'm just hoping it will get easier.
Billy: Marah, how about I give you a lift?
Josh: Wait a minute, now, you just got here.
Billy: Josh, I'm done.
Cassie: We haven't even eaten anything.
Billy: Well, I've had my fill. I think you should just give it a little time, okay, guys?
Marah: I love you, Daddy.
Josh: I love you, Marah.
Marah: Can't breathe, Dad.
Cassie: Josh?
Josh: One night. One night, that's all it took to prove what a car wreck this new family is.
Cassie: To prove to whom? To Marah?
Josh: Yeah, to Marah and to me and to Reva and to Billy and to you. Look at how it turned out.
Cassie: Well, you don't have to prove anything to us. We know how it can be.

Josh: Look at all this stuff. We can't even call it leftovers. Everything looks beautiful, right, it looks like it's ready to go on the table. But it's not actually beautiful, it's not actually perfect, or anything like that. It's not even nice and normal.
Cassie: I'll give you nice, but we both know we are not normal.
Josh: I think Billy was right. I can't pull a family together the way H.B. could.
Cassie: Yes, you can. Yes, you can. Just... and you will next year.
Josh: (Laughs) You want to do this again next year?
Cassie: It can't get any worse than this year.
Josh: Really?
Cassie: Okay, so we won't push it. How about we order pizza? We can give thanks for delivery.
Josh: You'll make R.J.'s day.
Cassie: This way we can make non-tradition our tradition.
Josh: You know what, I'm going to go outside and shovel a bit.
Cassie: Okay.
Josh: Make sure the pizza guy can make it up the driveway, you know?
Cassie: You know, R.J. will help if he knows pizza is involved.
Josh: No. I'll be fine on my own, thanks.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan: Look, I'll fly the helicopter myself.
Reva: What, so now you're a pilot, Alan? They are doing everything they can.
Alan: If you believe that, you're not half the parent you claim to be, Reva, because if anything happens to that little baby and Elizabeth...
Reva: Don't even say it.
Alan: ...It will be on your head. Who's in charge here? I want to see Dr. Grant.
Reva: Excuse me, you've been out there. I have to find my son. Any idea where I can find a cab?
E.M.T.: I don't know, you might try Main Street.
Reva: Okay, thanks.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: I'm hours, minutes away from being a father and I already messed up.
Tammy: Jonathan...
Jonathan: No, look, I've got Lizzie here. The baby is on its way. I skipped out on the birthing class.
Tammy: Jonathan, listen to me. You're not going to let your baby down.
Jonathan: How do you know that?
Tammy: You've already shown that you'd do anything for her.
Jonathan: This-- this -- is what I've done.
Tammy: You gave me up, okay? That's what you did for her.
Jonathan: Lizzie... Lizzie, how we doing? How we doing?
Lizzie: It's happening.
Tammy: If the ambulance doesn't make it...
Jonathan: Then we'll do it ourselves. We'll have the baby right here.
Lizzie: (Cries)
[NEXT_ON]
Doris: The governor has rescinded your appointment as acting mayor.
Olivia: How did he look when you told him?
Doris: Like his career was over.
Frank: You're out, Jeffrey.
Alan: Elizabeth came to the house when you left and she went into labor. They may have had an accident.
Jonathan: We're going to be a team, just like we were before, right? I can see her! I can see her! Just keep pushing!
